reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love Cambria and the surrounding area, It is a relatively short drive from the Los Angeles area but seems so far removed. It is so relaxing even to come for one night, though we have stayed as long as four.You can't runn out of things to do, Hearst Castle is 10 minutes down the road. The main shopping area of Cambria is accessable by a long walk (2 miles?) or a free trolley shuttle or a very short drive. Moonstone Drive is parallel to a boardwalk along the beach. Two excellent restaurants are with in walikng distance, the best is right next door.
reviews.title: Charming Oceanfront Inn. Can't be beat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This charming. family owned Inn never dissapoints. The rooms are spacious, impeccably clean and tastfully decorated. The Ocean front rooms have spectacular views but the side rooms also have oceans views and audible surf. The beds so comfy and the sheets are yummy. They have a substantial "happy hour" snack service in the afternoon,which we often miss because we are out enjoying the many wineries and shopping close by. There is coffe service in the room, We never use this as it is too easy to walk down the hall to get coffee and partake of the delicious continental breakfast. and chat with the friendly desk staff.
reviews.title: Perfect romantic getaway stop on California's central coast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place can't be beat. There is usually a family member owner on site and all of the staff are are anxious and eager to reccommemd wineries, hikes, beaches, surf spots or other activities in the area. The personal service here is incredible.
reviews.title: Loved Loved Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: They have also "gone green" which is important to me. No paper cupsbut you are wlecome to walk ont he board walk along the beach with your china coffee cub from the hotel.
reviews.title: Gone down hill...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This charming hotel was the perfect stopping point for my girlfriend and I during our weekend juant up the coast! Located right on the bluffs of Cambria's Moonstone Beach this hotel is amazing for a couple looking to be inspired while enjoying each others company. We booked a beachfront room which has incredible views of the ocean and cliffs... which we got to enjoy from our own private patio! Right next door to the Sea Chest restruant we walked to a delctable dinner and afterwards enjoyed strolling on the boardwalk in front of the hotel. When we got back to the room we opened the door to let the sea breeze and sound of the waves sooth us all night but kept toasty warm in front of our own fireplace. Sleeping with firelight and ocean air we woke up rejuvenated and ready to tackle Hearst Castle which is only 15 minutes up the PCH from the hotel. If you want a room to arouse your partner and relax your senses this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Moonstone Landing to celebrate our 20th anniversary. I searched and searched for a nice place with an oceanfront room. This was one of two available on Moonstone Beach. It looked newer than the other, so I chose it.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great View, Nice Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: We arrived on a sunny Thursdsay afternoon. The hotel is in the middle of Moonstone Beach area, right next to the Sea Chest Restaurant. It looked great as we drove up. The parking lot was empty, which was a little odd - but it was a Thursday - probably not peak day. Checkin was quick, but I am a little bothered because we were unable to get the AAA discount. When I called a few days prior they said it was available and that we could get the adjustment when we checked in. I asked Bob about it and he said our room was already discounted so we couldnt use the AAA discount. But on my receipt is says Rack Rate, right next to the amount we were charged. With tax and all, we paid $577 for 2 nights. So even if AAA was 10%, thats $50 we would have saved.. So I was a little bothered about that, but one with the trip..
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was ready, so we went right to it. Gorgeous view!!! This hotel is right across from the beach, so you have an unobstructed view of the gorgeous coastline. It was sunny and crystal clear. We sat on the balcony for a few minutes, but then got cold. It was windy, so we went inside. The room had a fireplace (fake - but nice), a king size bed, whirlpool tub (which was pretty anti-climatic. The jets were great, but there were none for your back - all of them were on the sides of the tub - so the outer sides of our legs and hips got a great massage. I was hoping for more, I guess. Still very relaxing and big enough for 2 :)
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: There was a mini bar area, with microwave, frig and coffee maker. The room was in pretty good shape, didn't look worn or dated. Bedding was crisp and clean. Nice comfy chair to sit in and look at the view, as well as a table with some chairs. The balcony was pretty big, complete with 2 chairs and a small table.
reviews.title: very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They offer a snack in the afternoon in the lobby. It was cheese/crackers/salami.. and juice. We thought this was a nice touch. The breakfast was just pastries/bagels/fruit/coffee and juices.
reviews.title: Awesome Place!! You will love it!
Great Location, Great for Families
reviews.text: We've stayed at this hotel several times, and it is well suited for families and couples alike. All oceanfront rooms feature a great view of the ocean and sunsets, and many have extensive balconies. There is a continental breakfast every morning and cheese, crackers, and cookies in the late afternoon. Staff is friendly and helpful; kids like the free DVD rentals. Location is perfect, just off Highway 1, short walk to tide pools, boardwark, and local restaurants; short drive to town, wineries, elephant seals.

reviews.title: The Perfect After-Wedding Getaway...
reviews.text: Moonstone Landing made for a nice retreat after the wedding, and my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our accommodations. We had a corner upper floor oceanfront room, and we took full advantage of the view. The nicely-renovated bathroom with the whirlpool tub and tiled shower was a nice change from tiny hotel bathrooms. The view was spectacular, even if the weather wasn't perfect. We had one night with a clear sky, and the view was outstanding. The staff was friendly, and parking was at a premium. The location across from the beach and within a few minutes of Cambria was wonderful. The best part was the fireplace, which doubled as the room heater. A fireplace with a thermostat attached? Yeah, this place was great!

reviews.title: Great experience, but room was hot.
reviews.text: Room was beautiful, everything was new. Fireplace very nice....doubles as heater. Staff was very friendly, knowledgable and willing to help. Food breakfast and afternoon food was very fresh and good quality. Partial ocean view is ok. If you stand by the window, it's a good view, but you can't see it sitting and you can't see it away from the window.

reviews.title: This Inn Saved our Trip- Stay Here!!!!!
reviews.text: Only complaint. Room was extremely hot. Even with the window open. I had to open the door to the hallway to get a breeze.

reviews.title: Love this Place
reviews.text: There is no air conditioning, as it is usually not needed since the property is just steps from the ocean. However, the South-facing rooms get constant sun all day long. After being out in 68-72 degree wonderful weather..you open your door and blammo, not quite a blast furnace, but hotter than comfortable.

reviews.title: Cozy Moonstone Landing
reviews.text: We recently stayed one night at Moonstone Landing as a stopover during our California coastal trip. Our room with a king bed was very large, very cozy, and incredibly clean. We had a second floor room with a partial view of the ocean right across the street. Our only regret was that we weren't able to spend more than one night there. The staff was very friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations in the area. I would recommend Moonstone Landing without hesitation.

reviews.title: best in Cambria
reviews.text: We arrived in Cambria without reservations for a romantic getaway. We looked for the properties that would have the best views and looked at 3 places, choosing Moonstone Landing. Luckily, the second floor corner room front facing the ocean was available and it's the best room in the house. It has both a full glass front window and a side window with fantastic views of the beach and coast. The hotel does a nice job - afternoon snack, breakfast were both nicely done and the staff friendly and accommodating. This place will definitely be on our list for a return visit.

reviews.title: Loved the View
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in February in one of the 2nd floor king rooms with a balcony and jacuzzi. It was worth the extra dollars.The view was amazing. with wonderful sunsets. The room was probably the cleanest room I have ever stayed in. Breakfast included wonderful fresh fruit and local bakery from the great Italian bakery in town.

reviews.title: Pleasant and Relaxing
reviews.text: The only strange thing is that the shower is not enclosed.

reviews.title: Great small hotel! A little pricey, but....
reviews.text: There is a solid side between the shower and the toilet. The rest is open. So if someone is in the jacuzzi, they have a full on view of you. Did not bother us but it might bother others. We thought that the shower being so open would make you feel cold. But quite the contrary, it stayed quite warm.

reviews.title: expensive-not worth the price
reviews.text: we asked for an ocean view room and was quoted $250.00. it was on a very windy and cold day during the week (thursday). the hotel was not full at all. we couldnt even open our sliding glass door in the room to see the ocean because it was torrential winds. they should have lowered their price because of the weather and that the hotel was practically empty. we felt ripped off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent an all too brief visit in Cambria. Moonstone Landing sits right across the street from the ocean and is absolutely gorgeous. The room couldn't be more perfect. The facility was pristine, quiet, right next door to an excellent seafood restaurant w/a boardwalk right across the street along the ocean. What more could you want? The staff, especially Mary, was helpful at a time when I really needed advice.
reviews.title: Kick off your shoes, put up your feet, totally relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the Trip Advisor reviews of Moonstone Landing, I booked a two night reservation online for the hotel. When we arrived with our confirmation information in hand, the owner said he did not have a reservation for us, and then proceeded to treat us as if we had done something wrong by booking online. He was unwelcoming, and very unprofessional. We had to find another hotel on our own.
reviews.title: Worst Customer Service
Great Spot
reviews.text: Our trip was saved by the Blue Dolphin Inn down the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice property. It overlooks the beach and the rooms are spacious, clean, and cozy. The rooms are heated by a gas fireplace which was lovely. Mary at the front desk was just great. This hotel is kept up very well and you can tell that the owners care about their guests.
reviews.title: Very clean. Friendly. Opposite the ocean. highly recommend you stay here
Looking forward to visiting again!
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived at the Moonstone Landing to find a pleasant clerk behind the desk, and a variety of meats, cheeses, nuts, crackers, and dips. It was a delightful surprise after a long day of driving. Our room was beautifully furnished, bright and cheerful, with a partial view of the ocean. The marble bath, the cleanliness, and the little extra touches and attention to detail were much appreciated. The gentleman behind the desk recommended several restaraunts, and we went with his number one choice. He had it right. The food was fabulous. The location, with a lovely walk on the beach across the street, is hard to beat. We enjoyed a nice breakfast on the patio outside both mornings we were there. The pastries had to be home baked, and the carrot and raisin muffins were to die for. We didn't want to leave, and will recommed it to our friends who head that way. Looking forward to another visit. Thanks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband 2 girls and I stayed here overnight on route to LA. We had booked a partial ocean view room but when we arrived we paid extra to upgrade to a room facing the ocean which we were told was now available. We could watch the surfers and waves crash in from inside our room and from the outside balcony.
reviews.title: Unobstructed views,large views,wildlife paradise

likes.disliked: — Not having time to stay longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach is a stones throw walk and is clean and easily accessible for able and even disabled people.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

likes.disliked: — A bit noisy in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were totally enraptured by the sight of sea otters and seals frolicking at the sea edge at various vista points and the antics of numerous ground squirrels . My dtr thought she was in wildlife heaven.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
A lovely place by the ocean with modern amenities
reviews.text: Our room was large and tastefully decorated with all mod cons. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and shower and huge dressing counter (essential for 3 ladies ).The plumbing on the toilet flush was a little lacklustre but hey !! There is an outside hot tub which my amphibious dtr used as the ocean was too cold to swim in and there had been a shark spotting in recent days .The lady on reception was very helpful friendly and patient and happily supplied DVDs to the girls so we could enjoy a romantic walk and watch the sun setting.

reviews.title: A wonderful inn
reviews.text: As the previous review says, not much to add. We loved this inn. We stayed for one night and wish we had planned to stay longer.

reviews.title: Best coastal Inn I've stayed at
reviews.text: The room was comfortable and very nicely decorated. There is a coffee maker, fridge and mini-microwave in the room. The bottled water was much appreciated. The afternoon snacks were just what we needed after a long day on the road: sparkling cider, cheese and crackers, dips and vegetables, cookies.

reviews.title: Very cosy and welcoming stay
reviews.text: The view from room 205 was outstanding. We watched the surfers against the backdrop of a gorgeous sunset. The sound of the surf lulled us to sleep.

reviews.title: Cosy Moonstone Landing
reviews.text: The bathroom amenities were lovely: Aroma Botanicals soap, Marche aux Fleurs ginger vanilla cream lotion (yum) and bath gel. The jetted soaking tub was great!

reviews.title: Charming Cambria Hotel
reviews.text: Continental breakfast was more than adequate and the coffee was very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location at a great price. We had an issue with the room when we first checked in but was given another room immediately. Clean, large bathroom, slept very well. Liked the fireplace, and the partial view of the ocean (upstairs room). Next time we would like to stay with a full ocean view since it has a place to sit outside and enjoy the ocean. The continental breakfast was adequate. Good coffee with a pastry and fruit to get you going....then went out for a real meal. Just steps away to the beach and a nice walk on the boardwalk. Went to Moonstone Bar and Grill for dinner~nothing special...would rather go into town..should have tried the seafood restaurant next to the hotel. Will definitely be back to Moonstone Landing.
reviews.title: Great location, price and comfortable..will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we've been coming to Moonstone Landing for the past several years for Mem Day weekend - once again, it was an outstanding weekend - can't wait to go back there again - rooms nice but not too gaudy, excellent value as well when compared to other hotels nearby especially when you add in the breakfast items and afternoon snacks - they do it right here!!
reviews.title: outstanding place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are coming to Cambria 3-4 times a year to get our "ocean fix" for the last 5 years. It was our lucky chance to find the most perfect hotel from the very first try. This hotel is the Moonstone Landing.
reviews.title: complete relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love everything about this hotel and would not even consider staying anywhere else. The hotel has the most perfect location - just across the road from the ocean and the boardwalk; very close to the shopping area and the restaurants (one is right next door). Rooms and bathrooms are large and very clean; service is great and friendly (especially Mary); breakfast is delicious with great pastry from local Italian bakery. They also offer evening snacks.
reviews.title: Best View on Moonstone Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: We usually stay in partial ocean view rooms since we do not spend much of daytime in our room. You can still see and hear the ocean through your window; however their ocean view rooms are awesome; we are planning to try it one day.
reviews.title: Comfortable and right on Moonstone Beach
